content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted Julia code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Use a regex to find all fenced code blocks in the markdown document
    # A fenced code block starts with three or more backticks, followed by optional language identifier, and ends with another set of three or more backticks
    # The regex also matches empty lines before and after the code block to include them in the extraction
    code_blocks = eachmatch(r"```julia?\n((?:\s|.)*?)\n```"m, md)

    # Iterate over each matched code block
    for block in code_blocks
        # If a match is found, remove the surrounding backticks and join the lines together with newlines
        code = replace(block[1], r"^```julia?\n|```\n?$"m => "") * "\n"

        # Append the code to the extracted_code string
        extracted_code *= code
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
